content: chris cross ankle socks a woven ~n~ spun creation www wovenspun com these socks were named for my son chris he was 9 years old when i wrote this pattern he told me his kindergarten teacher taught him to sit criss-cross apple sauce which when i was younger i called indian style when i decided to use a cross over stitch for these socks the name just screamed out for me to call them chris-cross ankle socks chain 10 work bottom bump of chain with a slip_stitch materials needed in 3 round chain from hook and in each chain across this will yarn knit picks sock yarn help reinforce the toe area hook used e 2 stitch markers once to the end single_crochet down the other side of the size beginning chain 3 single_crochet in the last stitch to make the nd to fit a woman s size medium corner mark 2 stitch in series with stitch marker single_crochet key in each stitch around to last stitch 3 single_crochet in last stitch criss-cross stich ccst skip stitch double_crochet in next stitch nd mark 2 stitch in series with stitch marker double_crochet in previous stitch skipped continue this coil pattern increasing 3 stitches in each corner stitch chain 24 and join with half_double_crochet where your marker is increase until you have continue half_double_crochet pattern across front of sock when you reach the chain area half_double_crochet in each chain continue pattern 25 stitches for a size 5 shoe for 2 row 29 stitches for a size 6 shoe begin ccst pattern and continue for 8 rounds or until 35 stitches for a size 7 shoe sock is the length you wish it to be 39 stitches for a size 8 shoe end sock with a row of single_crochet 45 stitches for a size 9 shoe finish off and weave in end after this you will no longer need the stitch markers for heel work half_double_crochet in next stitch and in each stitch around do single_crochet in corner area of heel and in each half_double_crochet and chain not join continue around in a coil around work pattern until you are approx 2 inches less then beginning with second round decrease in each corner the size of your foot mark side of sock with stitch stitch and continue with a single_crochet in each single_crochet around until marker continue half_double_crochet pattern to the other side of sock heel fits foot turn sock inside out and slip_stitch you have now defined the front or top part of sock
